chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent
Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell L. Rose Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to all previously imposed sentences.

superMiscConds.notes: To be determined - Restitution hearing to be scheduled.

Minutes:  14CF1362/14CF1479.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Victim rights compliance.  April L. present; statement made to the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  

14CF1362 - 

(Ct 7) - deft sentenced to 12-1/2yrs WSP; intial confinement of 7-1/2yrs followed by 5yrs of ES.  Credit for 380 days. 
(Ct 6) - deft sentenced to 40yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 25yrs followed by 15yrs of ES.  
(Ct 5) - sentenced to 6yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.
(Ct 4) - sentenced to 6yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.
(Ct 3) - sentenced to 6yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  
(Ct 2) - sentenced to 60yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 40yrs followed by 20yrs of ES.
(Ct 1) - sentenced to life in prison without eligibility for ES consecutive to all previously imposed sentences

Costs are ordered on all counts.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
Restitution is ordered; defense requests restitution hrg.  Deft is allowed to appear via telephone for the restitution hrg.  

14CF1479 - dismissed & read-in per stipulation now on file.
Exhibits S1-S74, D75-D77, S78-S88 and S90-S95 inventoried and stored in Br 1 Exhibit Room on 11/9/15. vm

Minutes:  Day 4.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:11am.  Trial resumes - Disc 1 of deft's interview played for the jury, & Det. DeJonge (direct examination completed).  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:35pm; jurors instructed to returned @ 1:45pm.  Juror instruction conference held.  Colliquey conducted with deft regarding his right to testify; deft opts not to testify.  In addition, Court conducts colliquey with deft regarding his previous NGI plea; deft stands on his previous decision - that is, the NGI plea was withdrawn.  Jurors reconvene @ 2:23pm.  Testimony resumes - cross examination of Det. JeJonge.  Remaining state's exhibits offered/received.  State rests @ 2:29pm.  Defense rests @ 2:29pm.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate jurors - Lauren L. & Robert H.  Jurors commences deliberations @ 4pm.  Clerk - Dawn Smith.  Verdict reached @ 5:20.  The DE was found guilty on cts. 1,2,3,4,5,6 & 7.  Jurors released at 5:40 p.m.  The state moves for motion to be entered on all 7 counts and for revocation of bond.  Atty. Johnson moves for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  The court revokes bond.  A PSI is being ordered.  Sentencing 12/3/15 @ 3:00.

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Jury reconvenes @ 9:10am.  Testimony continues - Dr. Brian Linert, Joan Zarletti (911 Dispatcher), Barbara H., Det. Jeremy Dewitt, P.O. Morton, P.O. Brandie Pie.  Jurors excused for lunch; instructed to return @ 1:15pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:35pm.  Testimony resumes - P.O. Brandie Pie, Ralph N., Det. Patrick Patton, & Det. Daniel DeJonge.  State attempts to play the DVD of deft's interview; issue with sound.  Jurors released for the day @ 4:10pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 10/29/15.

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before. Jurors reconvene @ 9:13am.  State continues with opening statement.  Opening statement given by defense.  Testimony commences - April L.  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:10pm; instructed to return @ 1:20pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:30pm.  Testimony resumes - April L., Kurt S., Elizabeth F., P.O. Michael Held, Capt James Miller, & Christopher Holtz (911 Dispatcher)  Jurors released @ 4:49pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 10/28/15.
E-mail to Tami Lehman from Eric Klinkhammer.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Voir dire commences @ 9:53am.  Jury selected @ 1:38pm.  Unselected jurors released @ 1:40pm.  Selected jurors released @ 1:50pm; instructed to return @ 3pm.  Court reconvenes @ 3:45pm.  Testimony taken from Sgt. Klinkhammer re: potential jurors seeing the shackles on the deft's feet.  Defense requests this jury be dismissed and the court start with a new jury panel; defense request is denied.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 3:53pm.  Jury sworn.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Opening statement given by the State; State's opening statement interrupted to release the jurors @ 5pm.  Jurors instructed to return @ 9am.

Minutes:  14CF1362/14CF1479.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Atty Johnson reports the deft w/draws his NGI plea.  No objection by the State.  Court conducts colliquey with the deft.  Court accepts the deft's w/draw of his NGI.  Case will proceed on deft's plea of not guilty.  Testimony commences re: Miranda Goodchild hrg/suppression mtn.  Witnesses - P&P agent Adrienne Wilder, Paramedic Chad Zielinski, & Det. Daniel DeJonge.  State rests.  No witnesses presented by defense.  Arguments heard.  Court finds all the statements are in compliance with the admissibility rules.  FPT 10/9/15 @ 11am, JS 10/26/15 @ 9am.  14CF1479 will trail.

Minutes:  14CF1362/14CF1479.  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Report has been received from Dr. Luzi.  Atty Carl Johnson reports the deft is continuing his NGI plea.  Atty Johnson reports they have obtained a doctor to perform a second evaluation.  Atty Johnson requests a status date to see whether a report will be filed.  DA Zapf requests the Miranda Goodchild hrg issues be addressed at the next hrg.  No objection by defense.  Hrg set for 7/17/15 @ 10:30am.  If a report is going to be filed, DA Zapf requests the report 5 days prior to next hrg.  File 14CF1479 is trailing.

Defense will not be supplying a report to support the plea of NGI.  Plea of NGI is only in file 13CF1362.  Atty Luzi forwarded a letter to the court requesting an extension of time to prepare report.  CH set for 6/4/15 @ 10:30am.  14CF1479 is trailing

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Brief discussion held.  Defense reports the deft is now changing his plea to that of not guilty and not guilty by mental disease or defect.  State does not wish to proceed today with the Miranda Goodchild hrg based on the plea entered today.  Status set for 5/18/15 @ 3pm.  Report shall be provided to the parties 5 days prior to the hrg.  14CF1479 is trailing this file.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  DA Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson & Atty Kristyne Watson.  Arguments heard on defense counsel's motion to adjourn - court will address at the conclusion of this hrg.  Arguments heard on defense counsel's motion for change of venue - motion is denied at this time with right to renew during voir dire.  Motion to seal transcripts taken under advisement.  Motion to seal deft's medical records - is denied; but defense has the right to renew re: prejudice.  Motion to strike certain statements of deft; arguments heard - parties to confer to see if they can agree or an editing conference will be needed.  Court suggests a speedy Miranda Goodchild hrg.  State w/draws their "other acts" motion.  Motion for adjournment revisited - no objection the State.  Court grants the motion for adjournment.  Miranda Goodchild hrg set for 4/15/15 @ 2pm, FPT set for 5/11/15 @ 1:30pm, JS set for 6/1/15 @ 9am.   14CF1479 trailing.
